conclusion: In serving the wicked, expect no reward and be thankful if you escape injury for your pains
Self-help is the best help; one should not pray for divine assistance until one has done one's best to help oneself
Those who idle in times of plenty will suffer want in times of scarcity
The loiterer often blames delay on his more active friend
Grasping at imaginary gains causes one to lose real possessions
Those who claim abilities they do not possess expose their true limitations when tested
Slow but steady wins the race; consistency outperforms sporadic brilliance
One is judged by the company one keeps regardless of individual character
The greatest kindness will not bind the ungrateful
No arguments will give courage to the coward; fear is immune to reason
Fair weather friends are not worth much; true friendship endures hardship
Great expectations often produce trivial results; do not make much ado about nothing
If men had all they wished, they would often be ruined
Pleasure bought with pains hurts; immediate gratification may lead to destruction
Each side tends to represent contests in their own favor
Those with vested interests cannot be trusted to judge impartially
Unused wealth might as well not exist; value lies in use, not possession
Natural advantages often prove more durable than artificial beauty
It is easier to advise good behavior than to practice it oneself
Boasters are exposed when called upon to prove their claims
Those who resort to evil pretexts to justify their actions deserve no sympathy when caught
Quality is preferable to quantity in offspring and achievements
Evil companions bring more hurt than profit
Trickery ultimately rebounds upon the trickster
Do not be in a hurry to change one evil for another
Little liberties are great offenses when they show disrespect
Old friends cannot with impunity be sacrificed for new ones
Notoriety is often mistaken for fame; shame may be worn as honor by the foolish
Those who seek to please everybody please nobody
Pride goes before destruction
The common lot of mortals is to sustain the ups and downs of fortune
Rulers without power appear foolish regardless of their nominal authority
Tyrants justify their injustices with false pretexts
Circumstances alter behavior; captivity changes one's options
There is no believing a liar, even when he speaks the truth
Time and place often give the advantage to the weak over the strong
Those who overestimate their own size relative to others court destruction
A willful man will have his way to his own hurt
Whatever you do, do with all your might
The hero is brave in deeds as well as words
Prepare for danger in times of safety, not when danger is upon you
Men trapped in a corner will fight with desperate courage
The more honor the more danger
It is easier to propose solutions than to execute them
Freedom is worth more than comfort in servitude
They are not wise who give to themselves the credit due to others
He who shares the danger ought to share the prize
Insults from the despised are more painful than those from equals
Courage fails only when the spirit within decays
Evil wishes, like chickens, come home to roost
Our mere anticipations of life outrun its realities
Labor is the source of every blessing; none but those who work are entitled to eat
In quarreling about the shadow we often lose the substance
A certain gain is preferable to an uncertain greater gain
Stoop to conquer; flexibility survives where rigidity breaks
Necessity is the mother of invention
A mother's love makes her own child the most beautiful in her eyes
Those who kill the source of regular small gains lose the prospect of greater future gains
Mutual support among interdependent parts is essential for the whole to function
Ingratitude renders previous kindness meaningless
Every man tends to recommend what serves his own interest
He is not to be trusted as a friend who mistreats his own family
The pretensions of the small cannot match the power of the great
Those who assume a character which does not belong to them only make themselves ridiculous
Giving up one's natural defenses to enemies leads to destruction
Persuasion is better than force
Contentment with our lot is an element of happiness
The desire for imaginary benefits often involves the loss of present blessings
Count the cost before you commit yourselves
Be on guard against men who can strike from a distance
Use serves to overcome dread; familiarity diminishes fear
No one can be a friend if you know not whether to trust or distrust him
Two unreliable parties do not make one reliable guarantee
Fine feathers do not make fine birds; external beauty does not indicate internal worth
Those who manipulate through fear and deception can destroy communities from within
Every tale is not to be believed
Those who overestimate themselves based on circumstantial appearances meet destruction
Those who switch allegiances based on advantage are despised by all sides
One swallow does not make a summer; single signs are unreliable indicators
Misfortune does not justify mockery; the reviler may face similar fate
It is easy to kick a man that is down
Men of evil reputation, when they perform a good deed, fail to get credit for it
Character revealed in youth indicates adult behavior
Those who cannot heal themselves cannot credibly heal others
Those who incite violence bear responsibility for its consequences
Natural instincts persist despite change of form or circumstance
It matters little if those inferior in merit appear similar in external markers
Patience and customization conquer aversion
Blame belongs to the true cause, not the apparent instrument
The safeguards of virtue are hateful to those with evil intentions
One good deed deserves another; kindness begets kindness
They who act without sufficient thought will often fall into unsuspected danger
Some men underrate their best blessings
There is always someone worse off; perspective reveals relative fortune
Everyone has their own particular weakness
It is better to sacrifice oneself with honor than to be destroyed with dishonor
Those who practice evil on others cannot complain when others practice evil on them
Attempting to please everyone results in pleasing no one and losing everything
Those who prey on the weak are themselves weak when facing the strong
Those who harm their benefactors deserve condemnation
Good counsel ignored leads to disaster
Partnership with the powerful often means absorption rather than equality
Try before you trust; verify reliability before committing
Nurturing evil produces evil consequences
Preconceptions distort perception; familiarity breeds confidence in familiar forms
We had better bear our troubles bravely than try to escape them
Ills come in troops while goods come singly
Betraying others to save oneself deserves no mercy
Those who work faithfully without promises deserve more than those who promise much
Truth is abandoned in cities but dwells in the wilderness
No refuge exists for the truly guilty
Those who seize what does not belong to them cannot complain of theft

Those who enjoy benefits in peace should not complain of burdens in difficulty
Ingratitude toward benefactors is base
Cultivate the favor of your true benefactors, not opportunistic ones

Wisdom often dwells in solitude after being rejected by the crowd

Small creatures exact large prices from great ones
United we stand, divided we fall

Real experience surpasses theoretical knowledge
Those given small matters cannot be trusted with great ones
Revenge outlasts the grave

External circumstances cannot fundamentally alter internal nature

Fear of worse evils often prevents escape from present ones
Those blinded by greed see only what they desire

Nature requires no ornament

Envy corrodes the envious
The strong do what they will; the weak suffer what they must

Better to rule in hell than serve in heaven for some natures
